page.title: 17FAMOUS PEOPLE
page.content:
Catherine Cookson _ A writer of over 60 books was born and lived in East Jarrow in 1906. She attended St.Peter & Paul's school at Tyne Dock and worshipped at the local church. At 18 she worked in the S.Shields Workhouse. These sites are now marked by commemorative plaques. She was awarded the M.B.E. in June 1985.
Lord Blyton _ Now a peer, he still lives in a council house in S.Shields. In his varied life he was a miner, submariner,labour representative and M.P. The two schools of Garnett Infants & Simonside Juniors were amalgamated to form a J.M.I.School on the street bearing his name.This new school was named after him and he visited the school to talk to the children and to show them his Letters Patent.
